article.p:

The illustration for January from
Les Très Riches Heures du duc de Berry
, manuscript illuminated by the Limburg Brothers, c. 1416; in the Musée Condé, Chantilly, France.
age fotostock/Alamy
January
,
first
month
of the
Gregorian calendar
. It was named after Janus, the Roman god of all beginnings. January replaced
March
as the first month of the Roman year no later than 153
bce
.
